verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. Maschil of David. Give ear <S%H238><s%> to my prayer <S%H8605><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>; And hide <S%H5956><s%> not thyself from my supplication <S%H8467><s%>.
Attend <S%H7181><s%> unto me <S%H6030><s%>, and answer me <S%H7300><s%>: I am restless in my complaint <S%H7879><s%>, and moan <S%H1949><s%>,

Because of the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%>, Because <S%H6440><s%> of the oppression <S%H6125><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>; For they cast <S%H4131><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> upon me <S%H639><s%>, And in anger they persecute me <S%H7852><s%>.
My heart <S%H3820><s%> is sore pained <S%H2342><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me <S%H367><s%>: And the terrors of death <S%H4194><s%> are fallen upon me <S%H5307><s%>.
Fearfulness <S%H3374><s%> and trembling <S%H7461><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> upon me <S%H6427><s%>, And horror hath overwhelmed me <S%H3680><s%>.
And I said <S%H559><s%>, Oh that <S%H5414><s%> I had wings <S%H83><s%> like a dove <S%H3123><s%>! Then would I fly away <S%H5774><s%>, and be at rest <S%H7931><s%>.
Lo <S%H5074><s%>, then would I wander far off <S%H7368><s%>, I would lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah
I would haste <S%H2363><s%> me to a shelter <S%H4655><s%> From the stormy <S%H5584><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> and tempest <S%H5591><s%>.

Destroy <S%H1104><s%>, O Lord <S%H136><s%>, and divide <S%H6385><s%> their tongue <S%H3956><s%>; For I have seen <S%H7200><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and strife <S%H7379><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%>.

Day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> they go about <S%H5437><s%> it upon the walls <S%H2346><s%> thereof <S%H205><s%>: Iniquity also and mischief <S%H205><s%> are in the midst of it <S%H7130><s%>.
Wickedness <S%H1942><s%> is in the midst <S%H7130><s%> thereof <S%H8496><s%>: Oppression and guile <S%H4820><s%> depart <S%H4185><s%> not from its streets <S%H7339><s%>.

For it was not an enemy <S%H341><s%> that reproached <S%H2778><s%> me <S%H5375><s%>; Then I could have borne it <S%H8130><s%>: Neither was it he that hated me that did magnify <S%H1431><s%> himself against me <S%H5641><s%>; Then I would have hid myself from him:
But it was thou <S%H582><s%>, a man mine equal <S%H6187><s%>, My companion <S%H441><s%>, and my familiar friend <S%H3045><s%>.
We took sweet <S%H4985><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>; We walked <S%H1980><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> with the throng <S%H7285><s%>.

Let death <S%H4194><s%> come suddenly <S%H5377><s%> upon them <S%H3381><s%>, Let them go down alive <S%H2416><s%> into Sheol <S%H7585><s%>; For wickedness <S%H7451><s%> is in their dwelling <S%H4033><s%>, in the midst of them <S%H7130><s%>.
As for me <S%H7121><s%>, I will call upon God <S%H430><s%>; And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will save me <S%H3467><s%>.
Evening <S%H6153><s%>, and morning <S%H1242><s%>, and at noonday <S%H6672><s%>, will I complain <S%H7878><s%>, and moan <S%H1993><s%>; And he will hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>.
He hath redeemed <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%> from the battle <S%H7128><s%> that was against me <S%H7227><s%>; For they were many that strove with me.

God <S%H410><s%> will hear <S%H8085><s%>, and answer <S%H6030><s%> them <S%H3427><s%>, Even he that abideth of old <S%H6924><s%>, <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah The men who have no changes <S%H2487><s%>, And who fear <S%H3372><s%> not God <S%H430><s%>.
He hath put forth <S%H7971><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> against such as were at peace <S%H7965><s%> with him <S%H2490><s%>: He hath profaned his covenant <S%H1285><s%>.

His mouth <S%H6310><s%> was smooth <S%H2505><s%> as butter <S%H4260><s%>, But his heart <S%H3820><s%> was war <S%H7128><s%>: His words <S%H1697><s%> were softer <S%H7401><s%> than oil <S%H8081><s%>, Yet were they drawn swords <S%H6609><s%>.

Cast <S%H7993><s%> thy burden <S%H3053><s%> upon Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and he will sustain <S%H3557><s%> thee <S%H5769><s%>: He will never suffer <S%H5414><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> to be moved <S%H4131><s%>.

But thou <S%H430><s%>, O God, wilt bring them down <S%H3381><s%> into the pit <S%H875><s%> of destruction <S%H7845><s%>: Bloodthirsty <S%H1818><s%> and deceitful <S%H4820><s%> men <S%H582><s%> shall not live out half <S%H2673><s%> their days <S%H3117><s%>; But I will trust in thee <S%H982><s%>.
